message.content:
cs.DB, cs.IR, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the fragmentation of XML data sources in the context of Business Intelligence and On-Line Analytical Processing (OLAP) applications, which are typically associated with database systems. Therefore, cs.DB (Databases) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the limited performance of XML-native database systems, which suggests a focus on improving efficiency and optimization, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) likely sub-categories as well. The use of the K-means clustering algorithm for fragmentation is a machine learning technique, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning).
